body:
> This guide covers building a Rails application that serves JSON resources to an API client, including client-side frameworks.

I don't think it's a bad thing that this guide has a little bit more information about API apps. Maybe how a controller and action looks like when using API mode? Please do submit a PR if you can.

Not sure if you would prefer an in-house solution/example, but there are several good articles explaining the basics of setting up RESTful API using Rails. One example from Oliver DS on Medium.com:

Set up RESTful API
https://medium.com/@oliver.seq/creating-a-rest-api-with-rails-2a07f548e5dc
Add authenticator and password hashing
https://medium.com/@oliver.seq/authentication-in-rails-with-auth0-4cc8ead3bd78

Possible solution is to add the following note to the end of 3.1 Creating a New Application:

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/adbb85be9ca0a876ae7b865a188c3db192732ab6/guides/source/api_app.md?plain=1#L134-L153

NOTE: It may be helpful to see an example application created from scratch. Please refer to [this article][medAPI] to create a basic API containing a list of user submitted facts. You can also check out [this article][medAUTH] about implementing authentication and password hashing.

[medAPI]: https://medium.com/@oliver.seq/creating-a-rest-api-with-rails-2a07f548e5dc
[medAUTH]: https://medium.com/@oliver.seq/authentication-in-rails-with-auth0-4cc8ead3bd78

If this is sufficient, I will happily generate a PR.

issue.title: Add link to tutorial on creating a basic RESTful API application.
issue.body:
### Motivation / Background

Fixes #46764
G33kNoob and hahmed made a good point that the API-only Applications guide may be improved with an example on controllers and actions for an API app.

### Detail

This commit adds a note to the end of the 'Creating a New Application' section with links to two articles on creating a basic RESTful API application and adding authentication and password hashing. The articles are hosted on Medium.com, which does not display advertisements or require log in.

### Checklist

Before submitting the PR make sure the following are checked:

* [ x] This Pull Request is related to one change. Changes that are unrelated should be opened in separate PRs.
* [ x] Commit message has a detailed description of what changed and why. If this PR fixes a related issue include it in the commit message. Ex: `[Fix #issue-number]`
* [n/a ] Tests are added or updated if you fix a bug or add a feature.
* [n/a ] CHANGELOG files are updated for the changed libraries if there is a behavior change or additional feature. Minor bug fixes and documentation changes should not be included.

body: I think it's better to avoid linking to another articles and writing our own example. Also, I don't think we need to add anything about authentication/securing your rails app -- that's better suited for https://guides.rubyonrails.org/security.html
@davidomullan I think it's a good start, but myself and others might have feedback, so would you be able to open a PR?

issue.title: Fixes #46764 API Documentation
issue.body:
### Motivation / Background

Fixes #46764 by adding further explanation of controllers in API only mode (via example).

### Detail

Guide for API Rails app is lacking example of what controllers look like in API-only mode. Added example of generating resource in API-only and viewing JSON output.

### Checklist

Before submitting the PR make sure the following are checked:

* [ x] This Pull Request is related to one change. Changes that are unrelated should be opened in separate PRs.
* [x ] Commit message has a detailed description of what changed and why. If this PR fixes a related issue include it in the commit message. Ex: `[Fix #issue-number]`
* [n/a ] Tests are added or updated if you fix a bug or add a feature.
* [n/a ] CHANGELOG files are updated for the changed libraries if there is a behavior change or additional feature. Minor bug fixes and documentation changes should not be included.

body: Out of curiosity, is there anyway for me to close out the change request to my most recent pull request? The only option I saw was to request a re-review from P8 (have done). Just want to make sure the PR shows up as ready for review. No rush, just want to know if I'm doing everything right. Thanks you!
@davidomullan Yeah, @p8 will have to update their review status. Please wait until we get around to finish the review. Thanks!
